result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heidi Jo Henrichs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Heidi Jo Henrichs appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Heidi Jo Henrichs.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Heidi Jo Henrichs appeared by video.  Attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons appeared by video for Heidi Jo Henrichs. Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel newly appointed and requests adjournment. Court grants adjournment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Heidi Jo Henrichs in court  with Attorney Fred Richardson III.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van  Grunsven, Branch 9.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/24/22 @ 1:30p
